alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 06 at 8:53PM EST until January 09 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Richland and Lexington Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Congaree River At Columbia. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs on parts of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. At 13.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs over much of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. At 14.0 feet, Roads in low lying areas and swampland downstream from Columbia become flooded. Most of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk is flooded. At 16.0 feet, Old State Road, SC 66, below Cayce becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 6.0 feet Wednesday evening. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 900 AM EST.
